text: Joseph 'Joey' Jacobs Sr. (born 5 December 1937) is a male former boxer who competed for England. ==Boxing career== He represented England and won a bronze medal in the -63.5 Kg division at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games in Cardiff, Wales. He made his professional debut on 12 December 1960 and fought in five fights until 1961. ==Personal life== His son Joey Jacobs repeated his Commonwealth Games achievement in 1986. ==References== Category:1937 births Category:Living people Category:English male boxers Category:Commonwealth Games medallists in boxing Category:Commonwealth Games bronze medallists for England Category:Boxers at the 1958 British Empire and Commonwealth Games Category:Light-welterweight boxers
title: Joey Jacobs Sr.
